intro: Eupatorium rhodotrichum, commonly known as the purpletop eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and sometimes branched. Eupatorium rhodotrichum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in wetland gardens.
